review: Had a horrible TGIF experience last week. I normally love this chain for consistent food but will not go back to this one. We waited 15 minutes in an empty restaurant for a table, 15 more to give a drink order, 10 more to get the drink and on and on....l overall a two HOUR casual dinner! Each step was painful. At the end, they forgot to give me back my stripes card so I had to retun, just one final nail in the decision to not go back . So sad......

Not all Friday's are created equal!!! We started eating at Friday's back in the late 80's, when I was a kid - our first one was in Columbus, OH and what fun it was!!  There are still some "good" Friday's, but this one in Harrisburg has never been that great.  We've eaten at this one at least 4 times in the last 3 or 4 years - we are always in the area during the Hershey car show.  The service is never great (and it was terrible the other night) - it wasn't even close to being busy.  The food was good - it's always the same at Friday's - but there was no excuse for the poor service.  And this is the issue we find with some Friday's - the service just isn't what it used to be.  Thankfully some of them are still "good" but unfortunately, after several years in a row, this location has failed to impress us. PS - She seemed annoyed when we told her we received a "Stripes" special - told us she had no way to look it up.  Huh!?

Wasn't my first choice of places to eat but, I ended up here.  Never been a fan of big chain places and this just confirmed my dislike.  The service was extremely slow which I could write off if the food was decent but, it wasn't.   It took almost 45 minutes for me to receive my burger that was not very good.  On the menu it was listed as a "100% prime burger with a fresh baked bun".  Why if its a quality high priced burger can I not have it cooked to my liking?  If you like these chain restaurants you will probably have no complaints, I was just hoping for more.

To start the server forgot to bring the chips and salsa out, which is complimentary for stripes members and in turn brought it out after our entrees. She should have not brought them at all because the chips were cold and stale. Our steaks were tiny, they looked like they were cut in half. They tasted ok though. My friend had a burger that came with chips which he described as "nasty." The drinks were fine strawberry and red bull passion slushes. She also messed up the check. Not a good experience at all.

This is the restaurant dump of the world. Never in my life have I had such bad customer service.  On multiple occasions we were turned away because they didn't have enough waiters to serve us. So instead of giving us a wait time, they basically told us to leave.  The staff is completely inattentive as well. I spilled water all over the table and myself and none of the waiters offered to help, despite being nearby.   The food isn't horrible, but the service is so bad we do not plan on coming here again. Not even as a last resort!!

What city does not have a Friday's.  It is exactly what you think and nothing more.  It is exactly what you would expect and nothing more.  The food is average, the choices are average, etc. Our waitress did something really odd.  We had 9 people at a long table (2 tables put together).  All 4 adults were at one end and all the kids were at the other end.  The waitress stood at the kids end of the table and took orders.  She literally was screaming to the adults.  During the meal, every time she came to the table, she always stood at the kids end and screamed to the adult end.  Really weird.  She would walk past the adult end to service the other table right next to the adult side.  Really weird.

Slow..not even peak time and we waited 35 minutes for food. Waitress and greeter were prompt. Adult meals tasted very good. Kids meals were nasty and we had to get the feed the kids again after we left.

My husband ordered two salads to go, one Pecan Chicken for him and one Yucatan Chicken for me. When he came home with our lunch, we opened the boxes. My husband's looked wonderful. Mine was labeled " Chip. Yuck Salad". This should have been my warning. I found a handful of lettuce, probably 2 oz. of chewy shredded chicken, a crumbled up rubbery tortilla chip, and some red onions, all over-seasoned which made my mouth burn and my nose run. It looked like someone's leftovers. I regret not looking for reviews to this place. I can't understand how it's still operating with such deplorable service and food. I feel cheated.

I haven't eaten at a TGI's in a while and we were shopping nearby.  I should have read the Yelp reviews before deciding to eat here!  The waitstaff were friendly and efficient.  The restaurant was clean and we had no wait on a Friday night.  The food--tasted good--but was not what I expected.  I wasn't starving so I ordered a salad and an appetizer.  The $8 appetizer stated Thai Tacos - 3 of them.  When they arrived they were 3 nacho chips folded over!  Seriously--not taco shells.  The salad was a salad.  My husband ordered the shrimp and chicken garlic skilled.  The salad was extra.  Again--small portion.  He got one beer--our meal was $40.  For what we got--it was not worth the money.  TGI--you won't see us back!

Me and my boyfriend came here for valentine's day, and it was packed and they told me.that they dont do call ahead seating which i think is stupid. Anyways, we prdered our food and about an hour and ten miiutes later we finally got our food. The manager personally brought it out to us and told us it was on him...The food was ok on a scale of 1-10 it was a 5.5

Can you give 0 stars. Got there about 10:15 and sat at the bar which was 3/4 empty. Was ignored for 10 minutes by the three bartenders. No eye contact, no acknowledgement. Even when the bartender was talking past me to people at a table off the bar.  Avoid this place

Never in my life have I experienced customer service of such poor quality. We actually got up to leave after being seated and waiting on drinks that never came, but we were stopped by a very embarrassed host. It was dead in here, and it still took forever to make any progress on our order. Singlehandedly the worst experience I have ever seen. I've had better service at Comcast. Do yourself a favor and eat somewhere else.
Worst service at any restaurant ever. Do yourself a favor and don't come to this tgi fridays!

Exceptional customer service! I went around 10pm after a long day at Hershey Park. The staff members were all friendly and courteous. Food was great, I got the Jack Daniels Chicken. There is nothing I would change about the service I received.

I'm going to go against the grain here and say I really liked this spot.  I'm a huge fan of Friday's over Applebees and I agree when others say "not all locations are created equal".  My experience while visiting the Harrisburg area was as expected, good service and TGIF quality food.  Server was attentive but the place was not crowded either so it leaves me wondering if people who normally visit are just cheapskates from out of town so maybe servers assume they'll get a crappy tip so they provide crappy service.  I can see how my server might have seemed annoyed at one point but it wasn't blatant so I didn't give it much thought.  Maybe after the good tip I left she gave the next person greater service, who knows. Food was TGIF quality and the place was pretty clean so overall my experience was that of a Friday's visit; as expected.

The worst TGI Fridays I have ever been to.  Every time we have come here (2 or 3 times), the food is less than par and the order is always missing items or incorrect.  I feel bad for the manager who has to pick up the slack.  If you want a soggy sandwhich and cold fries, you found your spot.

Food was okay. Unfortunately,  wait staff was extremely rude. They stood directly in front of our table and complained that we weren't leaving. It was not yet closing time and new guests were still arriving. Wait staff needs to be trained on customer service as well as the utilization of manners.

I love being able to write a good review for a chain restaurant after it's got a few bad reviews, especially when they're from folks who look like they just joined Yelp to write a bad review of this place :/ My husband and I aren't big chain restaurant eaters, but we do have a handful of favs, and TGI Friday's is one of them. My husband actually used to work at a Friday's, so we love to eat at one from time to time. We ate at this particular Friday's on a Sunday evening. I would say the restaurant was moderately busy. We sat at the bar. The bartender was great. I haven't had a bartender with that great of a "bartender" attitude in awhile. Funny, social, sarcastic, playful with the customers, put what we wanted to watch on the tv, offered suggestions from the menu and pointed out the 2 for $16 deal that my husband ended up getting. Our food arrived in a reasonable amount of time. The spinach artichoke dip was even better than we remembered. For entrees, I had a 6 oz sirloin medium rare with mashed potatoes and broccoli. My husband had the shrimp & chicken Cajun pasta. My steak was more on the medium side but it had a good flavor so I didn't send it back. The mashed potatoes were amazing. The broccoli came in a big chunk and still had the hard stem attached, but was good. My husband really liked his pasta but it came swimming in oil which was unpleasant to look at. It totally made you think of how many calories you were consuming lol. I had a few of his shrimp and they were super yummy. The beer was super cold, just like I like it. I could see a place like this getting slammed with customers on most days since it's located right off a busy highway, but I definitely will come back again. This location is exactly what I expect of a Friday's.

I recently went in for a quick meal for one. Ordered the flat iron medium rare and the steak came out a little more of the rare side (not that I usually minded but I wasn't able to finish this entree). I'm not one to complain usually but now I'm so impressed by the service given by the manager on shift. He stopped me on my way out and told me he removed the steak from my order because he noticed the rareness of the remainder of the steak. I'm touched that he took the time to check on my satisfaction even when the issue wasn't raised. Great service!

Came here for lunch today, service was good. The food was not the best that I can remember from TGI Fridays. I got the half rack jack Daniels ribs with fried shrimp.  The ribs tasted old, the shrimp had a very thick batter. My husband got the Jack Daniela New York steak and it was ok. Our bill was $52.00 and certainly overpriced. Went to Texas Roadhouse for dinner and got a couple cocktails, salads and split a 16 oz ribeye. We spent $47.00 and the food was superior. I would recommend Outback for lunch before here.

We decided to change things up, and go somewhere different for lunch today. Hi ho, hi ho, it's off to  Fridays we go! (went).   I ordered a build your own burger. You can select your own cheese, spread, and have the option of selecting two other items. These other items include a couple types of bacon, onions, mushrooms etc..  I went with bacon and onion straws.  My less than stellar rating has nothing to do with overall service or quality of food, which was on par with other TGI's I visited. I was satisfied with my order, no complaints. Our waitress provided good customer service. In fact my coworker's order came out with regular regular fries instead of sweet potato, she was quick to correct the mistake.  I usually come to Fridays for happy hour / dinner, and I'll continue to come in the evening. I would consider doing lunch on weekend, but  I don't think we'd come back for lunch during the week because the wait to table time was entirely too long.  We were seated around 12:15. It took some time for us to decide what we wanted.  We placed our orders around 12:25.  Our food came out at 12:55.  A half an hour is entirely too long of a wait for food when you only have an hour lunch.  I'd be more understanding if the restaurant were packed with people. Maybe a longer wait if we had a large group, It might take some time for them to get the meals together. There were only three of us, and they didn't appear to be super busy.  I'am a  regular customer, and desperately want to give higher rating. If I were reviewing a previous  evening experience I would have given a higher rating.  We came for lunch 4/8/16
Good decent fast food. Loved their 474 menu. Very friendly staff. Was traveling from penn state back to Maryland. Will come back again if we are in the area.

Stopped here on our way through Harrisburg.  Incredibly attentive and awesome service!  Seriously- I called ahead to check hours and the host was great, we arrived and he was even more accommodating, and once we were seated our server was on her game.  The food was standard TGIFriday's fare and the drinks were delicious (with a sweet special on margaritas).   Plus, they had a bunch of TVs so my boyfriend and I could pretend to pay attention to each other while really watching sports.  Recommend!

My boyfriend and I ordered take out from this location about 2 weeks ago. I got a burger, my boyfriend got a steak, and we shared the Oreo Madness for dessert. Both meals were fantastic. They were still hot when we got them home, the order was right, and everything tasted great, and dessert was great. Big enough for the two of us, and looked almost exactly like the photo on your website. That's the ONLY reason this review is getting 2 stars. Otherwise you would get  HUGE thumb's down.  We decided to get take out again last night, and both ordered burgers. He ordered pink, I ordered no pink. We both got overly charbroiled burgers that were way passed well done, and my was even burnt. The fries were cold. The burgers were barely luke warm. We had ordered a side of ranch for the fries, which we did not get.  I wanted mushrooms as an add on to my burger, and i received about 7 small pieces. Along with two of the smallest pickle slices I have ever seen, and about a 3 inch piece of onion. You are absolutely ridiculous with your topping portions, especially for what you charge.  We also ordered dessert, Oreo Madness, which was described on the menu as 'COOKIES AND CREAM ICE CREAM SANDWICHED BETWEEN LAYERS OF HAND-CRUMBLED OREO™ COOKIE CRUST, DRIZZLED WITH PREMIUM GHIRARDELLI® CHOCOLATE SAUCE.' What we got, was a layer of crumbled oreo cookies with cookies and cream ice cream on top, in a wax paper cup. All that was missing was the wooden 'spoon' you got when you were 8 years old. The was no chocolate drizzle, no strawberry, and only 1 layer of cookie crust. Incredibly disappointing for $7.60. I'll think twice before ordering dinner again, or anything online.

Visited on 2/18....Atmosphere was calm, not really busy..my complaint is with the "manager" who seemed to be too busy to answer questions; wasn't aware of any of the specials and seemed to refuse to come out to address a question about my bill after I paid using the app. Instead her went to every other table except ours....don't want to make this about race but it's what it appeared....either way he was not very managerial
Service is Horrible    Can't take a drink order  still waiting 48 mins for food  this place is a joke  DO NOT WASTE YOUR TIME
This was by far our worst experience here. Although our waitress was pleasant she needed reminded to do things. The food took FOREVER! 45 minutes for 2 endless apps. I am disapointed.
Food is usually pretty decent at this location. Tiffany the bartender is top notch, whenever I'm in Harrisburg I'll stop in. She is a true professional.

Requested a booth and the host took us next to the bar. He was absolutely clueless. Took a while before some took our order and it was the bartender. Since we did endless apps only, i knew it would take while for our 2nd app order to come out so we ordered it when we got our 1st order. Got a tall Miller Lite and it was flat. Apps were ok, for it being endless, standards on them shld be high. The boneless wings and poy stickers were prepackaged and just heated, the bbq flat bread wasnt that great. I'd go there again if i was desperate, there's better options nearby.

Worst dining experience ever. The male manager was hammered. They took one of our friends' credit cards and then said they couldn't find it. Police were called and it turned out they had a stack of credit cards in the back that customers had "dropped." The manager refused to come out and face our friends or the cops. If you have to go here use cash only and check your bill. They also charged for things we didn't order.

Very dirty! No paper towels or hot water in men's room. Woman's room looked like a tornado went thru it and it is only 2 pm. Food was good, no complaints here. Service could be better. We sat at the bar and had to ask every time we needed something. If there is a manager on the property I would fire him. Maybe corporate needs to do a surprise inspection.

If you don't care about service this is ok. The waiters take their time getting to you and once you are served you become a second class citizen.  Bring cash and Tupperware, figure out the bill yourself that way you can pay and leave when you are ready go. It's the area not the restaurant. My wife had to go ask for a box to take food home, after she packed it all she had to go back to ask for a bag. We waited 38 minutes for the bill to come.

Not busy for a Thursday night. We were sat and waited 7-10 minutes with NO ONE asking us for our drink order. We got up and walked out. Walked passed two different waitress who said nothing as well as the hostess who sat us saying having a good night. We won't be back.

Eh. I decided to take my son to a Fridays on a Friday. We were promptly seated. I noted the place was fairly empty as we came at a weird time between lunch and dinner. Our server was friendly, gave us the menu and disappeared. Long pause........finally he asked what we wanted to drink. My son ordered a Red Bull passion fruit drink, myself just a water. Long pause again...drinks come out and we order, I ordered wings, all flats and my son a burger and fries. The Red Bull drink was pretty tasty, I was admiring my cubes of ice but then I see a floatie or two in my glass and my stomach churned. My son says "what if it's skin?" I suddenly see the glass is very dirty. The server finally brings our small meals that should not have taken so long to make out, and I ask for a new glass of water and mention floaties. He brought me a new glass but it still was kind of gross. The food. My wings tasted like what you would get in your grocers freezer, very limp rubbery skin. Blah. I pulled the skin off and ate the meat but I was kind of bummed. My son liked his burger but it was not at all like the picture. No onions, no tomato. Just lettuce and two pickles and melted skin on a burger. I mean, cheese. Our bill was 28.00. I feel ripped off. The server was sweet but service was really slow for a boring afternoon.

The staff at this restaurant was awesome.  When our waitress got pulled away to cover a large group that came in, 2 waiters and the manager went out of their way to make sure everything was good with our table.   I've honestly never seen this kind of professionalness at a Friday's before.  It was very refreshing and quite wonderful!
Hope you don't have any issues because local and corporate guest relations simply do not care about customer service!

We go for the Jack Daniels.  Asked to cut into our steaks, done as requested.  Did not realize until later, that the steaks would be the hottest part of the meal.  The ribs and sides had cooled to lukewarm.  Sigh...we were hungry and persevered rather than send it back.  Contacted Reynald R at Guest Relations Support and got a boiler plate "We apologize your visit did not meet your expectations"..... The longer we thought about it, the more we realized that the lukewarm dishes were also a safety concern.  Went on line at Trip Advisor and Yelp to see too many one and two star reviews.  So this is not a one time issue, but a repetitive issue :(  So despite contacting corporate TGIF Friday's no positive solution or response.  Letting food cool can be a serious health issue, but apparently it is not one that corporate considers important enough to address.  There are way too many good options folks to put up with TGIF especially if main office knows and no positive change has taken place.  If you are in Harrisburg PA near Union Deposit, there are dozens of choices nearby.  Texas Roadhouse, Outback Steak House are right across the street!  and O'Reilly's Tap Room & Kitchen around the corner are much better options! So ditch TGIF Friday and go elsewhere!!!

I wish I could give this place zero stars. The waitstaff made us wait about five minutes to get seated. Once we got seated, we waited 15 minutes for the waiter to tell us there was a wait because they're so short staffed. What a great waste of half an hour.

When we arrived and were seated no one came up to greet us or take our drink order. I went back to the front to ask about this and no one was up front either! What looked like a kitchen staff walked by and asked if I needed to be seated. I told him that we didn't have a waiter and went to sit back down. Our waiter then came over and explained he had seen us sitting there but didn't know we were his table! We then ordered. Food took extremely long to come out. The food was ok but service continued to be very poor throughout our visit!

Okay. First of all, we went around 10. When we pulled up, we thought it was closed down because it had NO lights. It is completely dark in the parking lot and surrounding area. Strike one. We go inside and waited to be sat a few minutes which wasn't that big of a deal, but they weren't busy. So we get greeted by a REALLY friendly host and we're like, "oh okay, this isn't so bad at all." Well then we get seated in our seats where the table was still wet with rings from the previous table, a salt shaker that's completely empty, and not enough silverware. Then the fun stuff happens. Our server: Amanda, Cynthia, Rachel, Sarah, Rebecca, or whatever her name is comes over to get our drink order. From the beginning she puts out a fake smile and an attitude that screams "I don't want to be here." Strike two. She tries to hurry our order but we aren't ready, so she becomes annoyed with us. When we do order, the food takes about 30 minutes and comes to us in stages. The kids meal comes first with a sad excuse for a portion of old fries. Then my steak (medium well) comes and I was asked to cut into it. I cut and blood comes out, so I ask to have it cooked more. Well I ate all of my broccoli and mashed potatoes while it was supposed to be cooking from medium to medium well. Why that took 15 minutes, I'm not sure. So Becky brings back my steak which is now dry and looks well done. So I cut again and I don't think it was even cooked, probably put in the microwave to try and quick cook it. Strike three. I'm done. She brings the check, puts it down, doesn't ask if it needs to be split. Doesn't ask me why I'm clearly not eating my steak. Doesn't send a manager to follow up. Doesn't even ask how it tasted considering it was messed up the first time. She literally does not care and clearly does not enjoy her job. I'm appalled. Catherine was the worst server we have ever had and it wasn't even worth complaining because we will NEVER be back. I didn't even want to tip her it was so bad, and I have a guilty conscience. That's SAD! I see why this location has two and a half stars. We did take the steak home because my boyfriend will eat it, but they need to get it together.  Also, we checked the name on the receipts of which we paid for the meals we shouldn't have and our servers name was Samantha. She was terrible. 2/10, do not recommend.

I'll make this one short and sweet.   The burgers were good, and the drinks were good. Our server was wonderful!   The cleanliness of the establishment was absolutely disgusting. (See photo).   The dirty dining area is the reason I'll never eat here again. Well, that and the thought of, if the dining area looks like this, I'm sure the kitchen looks ten times worse!

Very nice service, the food was good, I went with 5 people's and everyone love it ,very clean restaurant,I came from Massachusetts for 3 day and I couldn't find a good restaurant but finally found TGI and I love it good food,

TL;DR incredibly slow, food allergies not respected. We arrived at 9:45pm, with a party of 16. First, they didn't give us enough chairs. Half hour later, they move us to an area with elbow room. It takes 20 minutes for the waiter to take drink orders, and by that time we gave him food orders too. Took another half hour for drinks to start coming out, 3 at a time. Then food starts coming out, and there are people still without drinks!  One of our party is allergic to peppers. She tells the waiter this. Her nachos come out WITH PEPPERS MIXED IN. She almost eats one!!! A manager is called. So sorry, we'll make them again. The nachos come out again, and there are STILL PEPPERS IN THEM. Manager says, oh sorry, the pablano has peppers in it. We can't make this without them. Finally, people are ready to get their checks. The checks are all wrong, nothing is on the correct check. Drinks mixed up, food mixed up, a huge mess. The last two couples didn't pay and leave until 12:30. Will NEVER be coming back.
Horrible service!!  Waited in an empty dining room for over 10 minutes to get a drink.  Then had to threaten to leave before anyone came out.

Don t waisted your time going to this place service was bad and food took for ever to come the Waiter was a jake ass never write anything down get the food wrong and it was cold forget food and drinks

Had lunch here which was not a good experience. The restaurant was about 80 percent empty during lunch time. We were led to a table that had a large puddle of water next to it (and I do mean a large puddle - like three feet across). We asked to be seated in another area. No worries up until this point.  After being seated we ordered our food. One hour later the food had still not arrived. The place was still almost empty and our server was nowhere to be found. Other staff were standing around texting. I interrupted the bartender and asked him if our server still worked there. The manager came over and explained that the computer system was down. The server, therefore, did not know our order was ready. He apologized.  Seriously? The place was empty and she couldn't figure out after an hour that our food was ready?  Anyway, about fifteen minutes later our food came. I wasn't sure if I had ordered sliders or two small bricks. It tasted about the same. To the manager's credit he didn't charge me for the meal but we paid for everything else. We tipped the server 15 percent, which considering the service was a gift. Not going back here and judging by the reviews neither should you.

I was coming here frequently, with my boyfriend, to get their endless apps. Twice now, we've had sticky stuff all over the table and have had to ask for them to be cleaned again. They often get backed up, between apps, causing you to wait 10-15 mins with no food. I've had apps brought out ice cold, after waiting this long. Now, they've raised their price to $15 a person and lowered the options available to just 4 but have kept the small portions the same. If it weren't for the happy hour (which a bit more than other establishments) and my boyfriend wanting garlic parm wings, I wouldn't even be here. I won't come again as I'm highly, highly dissatisfied.

Worst Friday's I've ever been to!!!! I was staying at the hotel right around the corner and decided to go grab a quick bite and drink. The entire staff seemed a little off (mentally challenged/drug usage). We were sat and nobody came over to us for about 5 minutes so we went and sat in a different section. That waitress who I'm 95% does drugs (I've worked in diners I know the signs) took about 10 minutes to bring us water. I also ordered a drink and it came out in the middle of my meal and was wrong. I sent it back and never got the new drink made... Overall it sucked and the food was lacking. Never again.

The service for the third time has been terrible ! Legit , my boyfriend and I decided to do the unlimited apps for the night . The server came with a bit of an attitude and took 10 min for two waters ..... uhh lol ok so then the apps took forever to come out . We had to scream for our server to even come by and bring us another water because we were all out. Never actually offered a refill , and would look straight in your eye and walked the other way . Other tables In her section complained , never complaining in my life we talk to s manager .... who started saying how bad her day was , ok well the service is terrible here lol like we literally wanted the check to go . We ended up tipping a nice food runner for getting us refills etc . Terrible

Walked in without a reservation- you know, because it's Friday's. Dirty bus bins on the tables, utter chaos abound. Once we were greeted by a disheveled man, who I would assume to be the manager, we were told there was a 25 minute wait. When we asked why and pointed out the restaurant wasn't even half filled, he said he only had three servers. On a Friday night at 6pm. We were invited to sit at the bar though - yeah, no thanks.
The food at this location was indescribably horrible two years in a row for our annual Farm Show visit. Completely out of character with every TGI Fridays that I have  ever visited. That is all.
